column4: When compiling C++ code with g++ i get an error:"fig1.cpp:13:2: warning: no newline at end of file"
this is a warning, not an error; add a newline at the end of file like it suggests
I am pretty sure I have a new line escape character entered at the end of my program
I am not sure what I am suppose to get from this: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25211/
xxd is a hex dumper, 0x0a is the ascii code for return, so you have a newline
can you pastebin just the program source please?
very interesting, i don't get this warning, but anyway you can ignore it
I added a blank line between keyword return and cout and now i do not get an error :)
How do I run a.out file after compiling with g++?
you can also use -o to specify another name than a.out
thank you for your time, back to readin my C++ book :)
